input_text:
Job Title: Enterprise Project Manager - Veterinary Software

Location: Westbrook, ME

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
As a Veterinary Software Enterprise Project Manager, you would be responsible for orchestrating an exceptional customer onboarding experience for veterinary practices bringing one or more IDEXX software solutions into their practice. You would partner with Sales Professionals, Customer Success Managers, and Product Specialists in design and execution of a customer centric implementation plan designed to guide the customer from agreement to first value delivery.

As An Enterprise Project Manager We Will Be Looking For You To Help Be a Thought And People Leader For The Organization As Demonstrated Through But Not Limited To Such Activities

Identify, create and establish standards and procedures for project reporting and documentation.Work with teams to identify and develop process improvements.Audit documentation to ensure compliance with IDEXX processes and ISO standards, if applicable.Assist in developing training requirements, training new enhancements and conduct training sessions as necessary.Leadership skills such as influencing without authority to achieve company goals and objectives.

In The Role Of Enterprise Project Manager

You will coordinate multiple projects and programs to support business objectives and assist project managers in the coordination and completion of projects.You may coach team members to help develop their skills.You may monitor day to day operation.You will keep an eye on team performance and keep management updated.You will create, review, and/or maintain project plans, timelines, databases and other supporting tools to track and report progress of key deliverables.You will identify, schedule and coordinate project and program meetings, deliverables, milestones and required tasks.You will track progress vs. plan, and resolve scheduling conflicts. You will create reports; maintain and update data; and create and maintain process documentation as needed for each project. Update and maintain internal systems as needed.You will create and establish project tracking metrics and reporting to ensure timely and on budget completion.You will prepare reports for management and staff. May present reports to management and staff.You will confer with various cross functional staff to outline tasks in the work plan.You will communicate project progress via reports, routine updates and business meetings.You will communicate project results which may include new reports and/or processes for the business.You will work closely with the management team and the functional leaders to analyze, report, and drive the critical projects, plans, events and action items through to completion.You will provide key support in coordinating and/or executing planned events, programs, field travel, etc.You may assist and/or lead smaller, basic projects and/or programs.You would utilize a wide array of programs to plan and strategize your customer projects and support the needs of your internal partners in delivering elements of the project to our customers.You would be seen as a trusted adviser.You would be accountable for managing your schedule based on the unique attributes and needs of your customers, while also keeping a focus on your own professional development and growth

Location: The Enterprise Project Manager is a virtual United States opening. Limited travel may be required: examples include educational summits, professional training, and occasional site visits.

What You Need To Succeed

You will have experience using a combination of telephone, email, Salesforce (CRM), Teamwork (project management app) and other SaaS solutions to ensure a high-quality experience with the training and installation scheduling of VSS purchases.You will have experience with maintaining open and productive relationships with cross functional (IDEXX) groups to create an environment of trust and accountability.You will have experience acting responsibly to manage customer contracts and expectations.You will have experience in reviewing contracts for accuracy and completeness, validate billing and system configuration.You will have experience monitoring the scheduling calendar and maintains a steady workflow for Product Specialists and Customer Success Managers. Anticipate issues, identify potential problems, and work quickly to coordinate needed training and resources.You will possess expert communication throughout projects and issue resolution will be required.Proactively reports customer feedback to help support customer satisfaction and process improvement ideas.You will have experience in participating in process improvement and other projects to improve overall customer experience and other initiatives.

 Why IDEXX 

We’re proud of the work we do because our work matters. An innovation leader in every industry we serve, we follow our Purpose and Guiding Principles to help pet owners worldwide keep their companion animals healthy and happy, to ensure safe drinking water for billions, and to help farmers protect livestock and poultry from diseases. We have customers in over 175 countries and a global workforce of over 10,000 talented people.

So, what does that mean for you? We enrich the livelihoods of our employees with a positive and respectful work culture that embraces challenges and encourages learning and discovery.   At IDEXX, you will be supported by competitive compensation, incentives, and benefits while enjoying purposeful work that drives improvement.

Let’s pursue what matters together.

 IDEXX values a diverse workforce and workplace and strongly encourages women, people of color, LGBTQ+ individuals, people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, foreign-born residents, and veterans to apply.

Experience Level (if available): None

output_json.title: Enterprise Project Manager - Veterinary Software
output_json.summary: Responsible for orchestrating an exceptional customer onboarding experience for veterinary practices.
job_responsibilities: Coordinate multiple projects and programs to support business objectives
Coach team members to develop their skills
Monitor team performance and keep management updated
Create, review, and maintain project plans, timelines, databases, and other supporting tools
Track progress vs. plan and resolve scheduling conflicts
Confer with cross-functional staff to outline tasks
Communicate project progress via reports, routine updates, and business meetings
Communicate project results including new reports and processes
Work closely with management and functional leaders
Support critical projects, plans, events, and action items through completion
Provide support in coordinating and executing planned events, programs, field travel, etc.
Utilize programs for planning and strategizing customer projects
Maintain open and productive relationships with cross-functional groups
Monitor scheduling calendars and maintain workflow
Anticipate issues, identify potential problems, and coordinate needed training and resources
Participate in process improvement and other projects to enhance customer experience
Contribute to improving overall customer experience and other initiatives
